One approach is as follows:
(a) expand the definition on node to include ab=
ility to maintain 
multiple unique inputs & outputs;
(b) expand node types =
to include embedded network;
(c) expand syntax of node in genome file to in=
clude filename of 
embedded network;

ames" <djames@...> wrote:
>
> Hello all,
> 
> I'm interested in implementin=
g an indirect encoding scheme in which 
the
> genetic representation is a n=
ested hierarchy, e.g.:
> 
> [area][module][neuron]
> 
> Where the top level=
 gene in the hierarchy specifies the spatial 
layout,
> connectivity, and n=
umber of elements of the gene just below it.  Is 
anyone
> familiar with an=
y similar encoding algorithms?  The closest I can 
seem to
> find is what X=
in Yao calls "parametric representations", and cites 
Harp et
> al.

y pointers or input would be helpful.
